protocol_name: Fish genome assembly and annotation pipeline
protocol_name_html: Fish genome assembly and annotation pipeline
description: From this protocol, we can know detail methods of assembly and annotation of the L. maculatus genome.

collections.protocol_name: Protocols for chromosome-level genome assembly of the spotted sea bass, Lateolabrax maculatus
collections.protocol_name_html: Protocols for chromosome-level genome assembly of the spotted sea bass, Lateolabrax maculatus

status_info: We use this protocol in our group and it is working

components.data: Quality control
components.name: Section

components.data: Get raw sequencing data in Fastq format. Filter the input raw sequences by using SOAPnuke (v.1.5.6).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Get raw sequencing data in Fastq format. Filter the input raw sequences by using SOAPnuke (v.1.5.6).

components.data: k-mer analysis
components.name: Section

components.data: Estimate the genome size (650 Mb) with k-mer analysis.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Estimate the genome size (650 Mb) with k-mer analysis.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 2 of The pipeline of assembly and annotation
source_data.protocol_name: Fish genome assembly and annotation pipeline
source_data.protocol_name_html: Fish genome assembly and annotation pipeline
source_data.annotation: k=17; about 27.7Gb reads from as input; the genome size with the formula: G = N*(L − 17 + 1)/K_depth, where N and L are the total number of reads and the length of reads, respectively, and K_depth indicates the frequency of k-mers occurring more frequently than the others.
source_data.thread_text: k=17; about 27.7Gb reads from as input; the genome size with the formula: G = N*(L − 17 + 1)/K_depth, where N and L are the total number of reads and the length of reads, respectively, and K_depth indicates the frequency of k-mers occurring more frequently than the others.
source_data.body: k=17; about 27.7Gb reads from as input; the genome size with the formula: G = N*(L − 17 + 1)/K_depth, where N and L are the total number of reads and the length of reads, respectively, and K_depth indicates the frequency of k-mers occurring more frequently than the others.

components.data: Assembly
components.name: Section

components.data:
1) Run SOAPdenovo2(v. 2.04.4) to assemble our genome.

2) Perform krskgf (v. 1.19) and Gapcloser (v. 1.10) to further close gaps in our genome obtained in step3.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
1) Run SOAPdenovo2(v. 2.04.4) to assemble our genome.

2) Perform krskgf (v. 1.19) and Gapcloser (v. 1.10) to further close gaps in our genome obtained in step3.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 3 of The pipeline of assembly and annotation
source_data.protocol_name: Fish genome assembly and annotation pipeline
source_data.protocol_name_html: Fish genome assembly and annotation pipeline
source_data.annotation:
1) performing "pregraph ( -K 57 -p 10)->contig (-g)->map (-p 10 -k 39)->scaff(-p 10)" modes in turn; 

2) using reads from all insert-size libraries.
source_data.thread_text:
1) performing "pregraph ( -K 57 -p 10)->contig (-g)->map (-p 10 -k 39)->scaff(-p 10)" modes in turn; 

2) using reads from all insert-size libraries.
source_data.body:
1) performing "pregraph ( -K 57 -p 10)->contig (-g)->map (-p 10 -k 39)->scaff(-p 10)" modes in turn; 

2) using reads from all insert-size libraries.

components.data: Repeat annotation_de novo
components.name: Section

components.data:
1) Run RepeatModeler to build de novo library based on the input assembled genome sequence.

2) Basing on the library constructed in step 5 as database, run RepeatMasker (v. 3.3.0) to find and then classify the repetitive sequences.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
1) Run RepeatModeler to build de novo library based on the input assembled genome sequence.

2) Basing on the library constructed in step 5 as database, run RepeatMasker (v. 3.3.0) to find and then classify the repetitive sequences.

source_data.protocol_name: Fish genome assembly and annotation pipeline
source_data.protocol_name_html: Fish genome assembly and annotation pipeline

components.data: Repeat annotation_database
components.name: Section

components.data: Run TRF (v. 4.09), RepeatMasker and RepeatProteinMask (v. 3.3.0) to identify repeats in the genome at DNA and protein level, respectively, by aligning sequences against Repbase library (v. 17.01).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Run TRF (v. 4.09), RepeatMasker and RepeatProteinMask (v. 3.3.0) to identify repeats in the genome at DNA and protein level, respectively, by aligning sequences against Repbase library (v. 17.01).

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 5 of The pipeline of assembly and annotation

source_data.protocol_name_html: Fish genome assembly and annotation pipeline

components.data: Gene prediction_preparation
components.name: Section

components.data: Mask these repetitive regions obtained above (step 5-7)  with 'N's.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Mask these repetitive regions obtained above (step 5-7)  with 'N's.

components.data: Gene prediction_de novo
components.name: Section

components.data: Run Augustus (v. 2.5.5) and Genscan (v. 2.1) to de novo predict genes in the repeat-masked genome sequences.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Run Augustus (v. 2.5.5) and Genscan (v. 2.1) to de novo predict genes in the repeat-masked genome sequences.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 7 of The pipeline of assembly and annotation
source_data.protocol_name: Fish genome assembly and annotation pipeline
source_data.protocol_name_html: Fish genome assembly and annotation pipeline
source_data.annotation: using parameters "--species=Lateolabrax_maculatus --uniqueGeneId=true --noInFrameStop=true --gff3=on --strand=both" when running Augustus; using default parameters when runing Genescan.
source_data.thread_text: using parameters "--species=Lateolabrax_maculatus --uniqueGeneId=true --noInFrameStop=true --gff3=on --strand=both" when running Augustus; using default parameters when runing Genescan.
source_data.body: using parameters "--species=Lateolabrax_maculatus --uniqueGeneId=true --noInFrameStop=true --gff3=on --strand=both" when running Augustus; using default parameters when runing Genescan.

components.data: Gene prediction_homolog
components.name: Section

components.data: Download protein sequences of teleost species (Danio rerio (NCBI, GenBank ID:50), D. labrax (NCBI, GenBank ID:2659), Gasterosteus aculeatus (NCBI, GenBank ID:146), Lates calcarifer (NCBI, GenBank ID:14180), Oreochromis niloticus (NCBI, GenBank ID:197), Oryzias latipes (NCBI, GenBank ID:542), Tetraodon nigroviridis (NCBI, GenBank ID:191) and Takifugu rubripes (NCBI, GenBank ID:63)), then align these against our masked genome sequences with BLAT, and then based on the BLAT mapping results, run GeneWise (v. 2.2.0 ) to predict genes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Download protein sequences of teleost species (Danio rerio (NCBI, GenBank ID:50), D. labrax (NCBI, GenBank ID:2659), Gasterosteus aculeatus (NCBI, GenBank ID:146), Lates calcarifer (NCBI, GenBank ID:14180), Oreochromis niloticus (NCBI, GenBank ID:197), Oryzias latipes (NCBI, GenBank ID:542), Tetraodon nigroviridis (NCBI, GenBank ID:191) and Takifugu rubripes (NCBI, GenBank ID:63)), then align these against our masked genome sequences with BLAT, and then based on the BLAT mapping results, run GeneWise (v. 2.2.0 ) to predict genes.

source_data.protocol_name: Fish genome assembly and annotation pipeline
source_data.protocol_name_html: Fish genome assembly and annotation pipeline
source_data.annotation: with parameters "--max divergence rate 0.3 --extend length for both sides of regions 2000"
source_data.thread_text: with parameters "--max divergence rate 0.3 --extend length for both sides of regions 2000"
source_data.body: with parameters "--max divergence rate 0.3 --extend length for both sides of regions 2000"

components.data: Gene prediction_transcriptome
components.name: Section

components.data: Download transcriptome data of the spotted sea bass from NCBI. The data was assembled by Trinity (v.2013.11). Mapp this sequence to our genome with BLAT and then based on the BLAT results, reduced redundancy genes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Download transcriptome data of the spotted sea bass from NCBI. The data was assembled by Trinity (v.2013.11). Mapp this sequence to our genome with BLAT and then based on the BLAT results, reduced redundancy genes.

source_data.protocol_name_html: Fish genome assembly and annotation pipeline

components.data: Gene prediction_GLEAN
components.name: Section

components.data: Integrate genes predicted in step 9-11 to obtain the consensus gene set by using GLEAN.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Integrate genes predicted in step 9-11 to obtain the consensus gene set by using GLEAN.

source_data.annotation: filtering with criterion "overlap cutoff 0.8 and at least one homolog support"
source_data.thread_text: filtering with criterion "overlap cutoff 0.8 and at least one homolog support"
source_data.body: filtering with criterion "overlap cutoff 0.8 and at least one homolog support"

components.data: Final gene set
components.name: Section

components.data: Added the genes which were supported by the transcriptome data and D. labrax’s based prediction after manual evolution to the GLEAN gene set.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Added the genes which were supported by the transcriptome data and D. labrax’s based prediction after manual evolution to the GLEAN gene set.

components.data: Functional annotation
components.name: Section

components.data: Map protein sequences of the final gene set to existing databases to identify their functions or motifs, such as SwissProt, TrEMBL, KEGG, InterPro.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Map protein sequences of the final gene set to existing databases to identify their functions or motifs, such as SwissProt, TrEMBL, KEGG, InterPro.

source_data.protocol_name_html: Fish genome assembly and annotation pipeline
source_data.annotation: SwissProt, TrEMBL and KEGG: using BLASTP; Interpro: using InterProScan (version 4.7) with seven different models (Profilescan, blastprodom, HmmSmart, HmmPanther, HmmPfam, FPrintScan and Pattern-Scan)
source_data.thread_text: SwissProt, TrEMBL and KEGG: using BLASTP; Interpro: using InterProScan (version 4.7) with seven different models (Profilescan, blastprodom, HmmSmart, HmmPanther, HmmPfam, FPrintScan and Pattern-Scan)
source_data.body: SwissProt, TrEMBL and KEGG: using BLASTP; Interpro: using InterProScan (version 4.7) with seven different models (Profilescan, blastprodom, HmmSmart, HmmPanther, HmmPfam, FPrintScan and Pattern-Scan)
